events.name: Lunch and Chat with Bluemix
events.description: With the upcoming announcement of IBM Blue Studio at Blk 71 and the newly formed BluemixSG community, you are invited to join us for lunch and chat with the IBM Bluemix experts. Agenda: 12:00 LUNCH 12:30 5 mins introduction to the IBMers 12:35 Continue LUNCH 14:00 Finish LUNCH I hope all of you can come!

events.name: IBM Cloud Workshop (Bluemix + SoftLayer) for DBS Blockchain Hackathon
events.description: Can't find the time to get your hands dirty with Bluemix and SoftLayer? Here's the chance to come down for an introductory hands-on workshop session with our Bluemix and SoftLayer experts and start developing with Bluemix and SoftLayer. Note: This is a "Bring your own Laptop" workshop. Take the opportunity to build and deploy applications and services in a matter of hours on Bluemix (built on SoftLayer)! As part of this workshop you will be able to: • Learn the fundamentals of building and deploying your application in the Cloud • Work with Bluemix experts on how to use the product and build your application Build your own simple application or use our sample labs and learn how to build and deploy on Bluemix and SoftLayer. Partner and Event Sponsor: NUS Enterprise@Blk71 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-18 Singapore[masked] t:[masked] e: [masked] w: www.blk71.com f: https://www.facebook.com/plugin.blk71

events.name: [Workshop] Learn Arduino Basics at our Electric Party!
events.description: UPDATE: ALL SLOTS ARE FULL FOR THIS WORKSHOP! SG Geek Girls and 12 Geeks are teaming up to hold a basics Arduino workshop called 'Electric Party'! Cost : S$50 for SG Geek Girls (females only), S$80 for Public Addon: - Bring home your Arduino - S$30 Prices are in SGD. REGISTRATION LINK : http://learn.12geeks.com/event/7 Join us for our first workshop of 2015! Arduino is an open-source electronics platform based on easy-to-use hardware and software. It's intended for anyone making interactive projects. In this "workshop" - you will learn the fundamentals of Arduino programming and have fun making your party gadgets with the Arduino, LEDs, sensors, actuators and simple everyday materials. We will also turn off the lights and party. *Basic programming knowledge will be great though not required. Only 5 spaces available. :) Thursday, 23 April 2015. 7pm - 10pm - Hackerspace.SG Please bring your own laptop installed with the Arduino IDE. Available for download here: http://www.arduino.cc/en/main/software PLEASE REGISTER AT: http://learn.12geeks.com/event/7 RSVP-ing here is not an automatic confirmation of your attendance, you will have to make payment at the link above!

events.name: April Meetup2, featuring Colored Coins: colu.co
events.description: Amos Meiri from Colu.co will be in town and will give us an introduction to colu.co and colored coins. Colored coins allow you to use bitcoin to send other digitized assets. We'll be holding the meetup at Zann's coworking place over in Chinatown. Hong Lim Complex 531 Upper Cross Street #03-11, 'Work Lor' for her. The staircase leading up to the office is nearer to the chinatown station on Downtown line. The office is sort of the middle of block 531. We're taking donations for Wine/Softdrinks for events- this is a multi-sig wallet 2/3 signed by David, Vincent or Zann. https://blockchain.info/address/3GH1os44K7YAPV6BWUUiFknz2erzxpJEhy Please RSVP so we can know numbers. Thanks, David
events.location: Hong Lim Complex, 531 Upper Cross Street #03-11, Singapore
